input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSMActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having multiple child "item" elements, which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Delete Vendor
This wrapper deletes a ‘Vendor’.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>delete-vendor</operation-name> <model> <keys> <vendor-name> <value>MyVendorName10</value> <type>String</type> </vendor-name> <location> <value>location10</value> <type>String</type> </location> </keys> <instance> <vendor-name> <value>MyVendorName10</value> <type>String</type> </vendor-name> <location> <value>location10</value> <type>String</type> </location> <address> <type>Array</type> <address> <element> <value>Address1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>Address2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </address> </address> <city> <value>Noida-updated</value> <type>String</type> </city> <zip-code> <value>111111</value> <type>String</type> </zip-code> <sales-rep> <value>Sales Rep</value> <type>String</type> </sales-rep> <sales-manager> <value>Sales Manager</value> <type>String</type> </sales-manager> <sales-manager-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </sales-manager-phone> <service-contact> <value>Technician</value> <type>String</type> </service-contact> <service-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </service-phone> <after-hours-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </after-hours-phone> <open-time> <value>08:00:00</value> <type>Time</type> </open-time> <close-time> <value>09:00:00</value> <type>Time</type> </close-time> <sales-rep-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </sales-rep-phone> <country> <value>Country</value> <type>String</type> </country> <email> <value>Email</value> <type>String</type> </email> <vendor-i-d> <value>ID</value> <type>String</type> </vendor-i-d> <contract-number> <value>Contact No</value> <type>String</type> </contract-number> <contract-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </contract-phone> <order-person> <value>Order Contact</value> <type>String</type> </order-person> <order-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </order-phone> <contract-person> <value>Contact Person</value> <type>String</type> </contract-person> <is-vendor> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </is-vendor> <is-manufacturer> <value>false</value> <type>Boolean</type> </is-manufacturer> <u-r-l> <value>u r l</value> <type>String</type> </u-r-l> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements’ Description:
Deletion takes place in following steps-
1. the entry to be deleted is first located by logically ANDing the tags provided in request. 2. the located entry is deleted.
Note- Delete wrappers can delete a single record only. If information provided in request refers to zero or more than one record, then no record is deleted.
Complete Elements’ Description:
item [Required] This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required] : This is used to specify the operation that needs to be performed.
Valid values: delete-vendor
model[Required]: It is the parent tag for containing all other tags.
keys [Required] : used as a unique identifier of the records by the application.
instance [Required]: It can have several child elements. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
vendor-name[Required]: The name of the vendor.
Name of this element in the application: General > Name.
Valid Value: Any string.
location[Optional]: The location information.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Location.
Valid Values: Any string.
Note: This is a required tag when tag <vendor-name> alone is not able to uniquely locate the 'Vendor' entry to be deleted.
address [Optional]: It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple child elements can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Note: one element shows one line in the address field.
element [Optional]: Shows one line in the address field.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Address. One element represent one line.
Valid Values: Any string.
city[Optional]: The city name.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Second field of Address.
Valid Values: Any string.
zip-code [Optional]: the zip code related to address.
Name of this element in the application: Location > 4th field of Address.
Valid Values: Any string.
sales-rep[Optional]: Sales rep. information.
Name of this field in the application: Sales > Sales Rep.
Valid Values: Any string.
sales-manager[Optional]: The sales manager.
Name of this element in the application: Sales > Sales Manager.
Valid Values: Any string.
sales-manager-phone[Optional]: The phone number of the sales manager.
Name of this element in the application: Sales > Phone (below the 'Sales Manager')
Valid values: Any string.
service-contact[Optional]: The service contact.
Name of this element in the application: Service > Technician.
Valid Values: Any string.
service-phone[Optional]: The service contact number.
Name of this element in the application: Service > Phone (below the 'Technician').
Valid Values: Any string.
after-hours-phone[Optional]: The contact during off work.
Name of this element in the application: Service > Phone (below 'After-Hours Contact')
Valid Values: Any string.
open-time [Optional]: The open time for services.
Name of this element in the application: Service > Hours (1st field)
Valid Values: Any input in ‘Time’ format: HH:MM:SS HH -> hour, MM -> min, SS -> second
close-time [Optional]: The close time for services.
Name of this element in the application: Service > Hours (2nd field)
Valid Values: Any input in ‘Time’ format: HH:MM:SS HH -> hour, MM -> min, SS -> second
sales-rep-phone [Optional]: The phone number of sales Rep.
Name of this element in the application: Sales > Phone (below 'Sales Rep'.)
valid Values: Any string.
country [Optional]: The country name.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Country.
Valid Values: Any string.
email [Optional]: The email address.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Email.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
vendor-i-d [Optional]: The vendor ID.
Name of this field in the application: General > ID.
Valid Values: Any string.
contract-number [Optional]: the contract number.
Name of this element in the application: General > Contract No.
Valid Values: Any string.
contract-person [Optional]: The contract person.
Name of this field in the application: General > Contract Person.
Valid Values: Any string.
contract-phone [Optional]: the phone number of contract person. Name of this field in the application: General > Phone(below 'Contract Person').
Valid Values: Any string.
order-person [Optional]: The name of order person.
Name of this element in the application: General > Order Contact.
Valid Values: Any string.
order-phone [Optional]: The phone number of order.
Name of this element in the application: General > Phone (below 'Order Contact')
Valid Values: Any string.
is-vendor [Optional]:
Name of this element in the application: Location > Is Vendor (Check Box).
Valid Values: true/ false.
True -> vendor, False -> not vendor.
is-manufacturer [Optional]:
Name of this element in the application: Location > Is Manufacturer (Check Box).
Valid Values: true/ false.
u-r-l [Optional]: the url for the record.
Name of this element in the application: General > URL.
Valid Values: Any string.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.
